It looks like I've answered my own question.  I'll be writing a decide
rule=
 which makes an RPC call.  I'm not going to serialize the CrawlURI
as I pla=
n on using Perl on server side, but I will pass by all the
most pertinent m=
embers of the CrawlURI class (different statuses, URI,
content info, actual=
 content from the Recorder, and whatever else
looks interesting).  

I'll a=
lso be writing a custom processor that will stop a CrawlURI's
processing.  =
How would I go about removing a CrawlURI from the chain
of processing?  Wou=
ld just calling stripToMinimal() on it?

Thanks,
Kaleb

--- In archive-craw=
ler@yahoogroups.com, "Kaleb" <lostokies@...> wrote:
>
> I'm back looking at=
 Heritrix and how I would implement an RPC decide
> rule, but I need to ret=
hink how to go about this.  I need Heritrix to
> make an RPC call, passing =
the HTML contents to the RPC server, and
> based upon the response, extract=
ing the URI's or not.  
> 
> So perhaps what I need is a custom extractor, =
that inherits from any
> of the other extractor types, but makes an RPC cal=
l before actually
> doing an extraction.  If the RPC comes back true, then =
do the
> extraction, if not then return null.
> 
> Anyone have any ideas?  =
I simply want to decide if I want to use the
> extracted URI's based on the=
 content of the HTML.
> 
> Thanks,
> Kaleb
